Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ruminococcin A (RumA, natural AMPs; lantibiotic, class 2a bacteriocin; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes, UCSS1b)
Sequence Information.Source: Ruminococcus gnavus, a bacterium from human feces;  human microbiota:gut, symbiont bacteria

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the unmodified sequence of this peptide shows 84% similarity tolacticin LMG.Activity: Active against B. longum ATCC 15707 (MIC 75 UG/ML), E. contortum ATCC 25540 (MIC 32.5 UG/ML), R. obeum ATCC 29174 (MIC 32.5 ug/ml), R. gnavus ATCC 29149 (MIC 75 ug/ml), C. perfringens CpA (MIC 75 UG/ML), C. difficile serogroup A B-1 (MIC 75 UG/ML), C. difficile serogroup C C253 (MIC 75 UG/ML), C. difficile serogroup S3 (MIC 75 UG/ML), C. botulinum (MIC 75 UG/ML), C. bifermentans (MIC 75 UG/ML), and B. cereus Z4222(MIC 75 UG/ML), TZ415 (mic 75 ug/ml). Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Dabard J, Bridonneau C, Phillipe C, Anglade P, Molle D, Nardi M, Ladir√© M, Girardin H, Marcille F, Gomez A, Fons M.2001
Literature Information.Title: Ruminococcin A, a new lantibiotic produced by a Ruminococcus gnavus strain isolated from human feces
